org.apache.hadoop.net

Class StaticMapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.net.AbstractDNSToSwitchMapping
      • org.apache.hadoop.net.StaticMapping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, DNSToSwitchMapping

    public class StaticMapping
extends AbstractDNSToSwitchMapping
    Implements the DNSToSwitchMapping via static mappings. Used in testcases that simulate racks, and in the org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.MiniDFSCluster A shared, static mapping is used; to reset it call resetMap(). When an instance of the class has its setConf(Configuration) method called, nodes listed in the configuration will be added to the map. These do not get removed when the instance is garbage collected. The switch mapping policy of this class is the same as for the ScriptBasedMapping -the presence of a non-empty topology script. The script itself is not used.

    • Field Detail

      • KEY_HADOOP_CONFIGURED_NODE_MAPPING

        public static final String KEY_HADOOP_CONFIGURED_NODE_MAPPING
        Key to define the node mapping as a comma-delimited list of host=rack mappings, e.g. host1=r1,host2=r1,host3=r2.

        Value: "hadoop.configured.node.mapping"

        Important: spaces not trimmed and are considered significant.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • addNodeToRack

        public static void addNodeToRack(String name,
                 String rackId)

        Parameters:

        rackId - rack ID

      • resolve

        public List<String> resolve(List<String> names)
        Description copied from interface: DNSToSwitchMapping
        Resolves a list of DNS-names/IP-addresses and returns back a list of switch information (network paths). One-to-one correspondence must be maintained between the elements in the lists. Consider an element in the argument list - x.y.com. The switch information that is returned must be a network path of the form /foo/rack, where / is the root, and 'foo' is the switch where 'rack' is connected. Note the hostname/ip-address is not part of the returned path. The network topology of the cluster would determine the number of components in the network path.

        If a name cannot be resolved to a rack, the implementation should return NetworkTopology.DEFAULT_RACK. This is what the bundled implementations do, though it is not a formal requirement

        Parameters:
        names - the list of hosts to resolve (can be empty)
        Returns:
        list of resolved network paths. If names is empty, the returned list is also empty

      • isSingleSwitch

        public boolean isSingleSwitch()
        The switch policy of this mapping is driven by the same policy as the Scripted mapping: the presence of the script name in the configuration file
        Overrides:
        isSingleSwitch in class AbstractDNSToSwitchMapping
        Returns:
        false, always

      • reloadCachedMappings

        public void reloadCachedMappings()
        Description copied from interface: DNSToSwitchMapping
        Reload all of the cached mappings. If there is a cache, this method will clear it, so that future accesses will get a chance to see the new data.

      • reloadCachedMappings

        public void reloadCachedMappings(List<String> names)
        Description copied from interface: DNSToSwitchMapping
        Reload cached mappings on specific nodes. If there is a cache on these nodes, this method will clear it, so that future accesses will see updated data.
